contentrichtext.text: {{about||the professional baseball team|Oakland Oaks (PCL)|the American Basketball League team|Oakland Oaks (ABL)}} [[File:OaklandOaks.png|right]] The '''Oakland Oaks''' were a charter member of the original [[American Basketball Association]]. Formed in February 1967 as the '''Oakland Americans''', the team changed its name to the Oaks prior to play that fall. Playing in the ABA during the 1967-68 and 1968-69 seasons at the [[Oakland Arena]], the team colors were green and gold. The Oaks were owned in part by pop singer [[Pat Boone]]. They were probably noted more for a major contract dispute with the cross-bay [[San Francisco Warriors]] of the established [[National Basketball Association]] over the rights to star player [[Rick Barry]] than for any on-court accomplishments. Barry, a former NBA Rookie of the Year who led the Warriors to the NBA finals in 1966-67, was so angered by management's failure to pay him certain incentive awards he felt he was due that he sat out the 1967-1968 season. He joined the Oaks in the following year, leading the franchise to the ABA championship in 1968-69.<ref>http://www.remembertheaba.com/Oakland-Oaks.html</ref> With or without Barry, the team proved to be a very poor investment for Boone and his co-owners. Despite winning the ABA championship, the Oaks were an abysmal failure at the box office, due in large part to the proximity of the NBA Warriors. The team was sold and moved to [[Washington, D.C.]] for the 1969-1970 season, where it was renamed the [[Washington Caps]]. After one season in the nation's capital, the team moved to [[Norfolk, Virginia]] for the 1970-71 season and became the [[Virginia Squires]]. The team disbanded after the 1975-76 season, keeping it out of the [[ABA-NBA merger]] which occurred just weeks later. <ref>http://www.remembertheaba.com/Oakland-Oaks.html</ref> An earlier [[Oakland Oaks (ABL)|Oakland Oaks]] basketball team played in the [[American Basketball League 1961-63|American Basketball League]] in 1962. ==References== <references /> ==External links== *[http://www.remembertheaba.com/Oakland-Oaks.html Oakland Oaks site at remembertheaba.com] *[http://remembertheaba.com/TeamMaterial/VirginiaMaterial/OaksCapsSquiresYearly.html Year-to-Year Franchise Notes] {{ABA seasons}} {{ABAteams}} {{ABAChampions}} {{Oakland Oaks 1968-69 ABA champions}} [[Category:American Basketball Association teams]] [[Category:Defunct basketball teams]] [[Category:Oakland Oaks]] [[Category:Sports clubs established in 1967]] [[Category:Sports clubs disestablished in 1969]]
